page.title: 06VILLAGE SHOP
page.content: The village shop first opened in 1934 and was run by Mrs. Lily Manders from 1936 till 1978. It was closed for 1.5 years, it has been run by Mrs. Dale- Evans since 1980. The Post- Office opened in 1982. Mrs. Dale-Evans sells fresh and frozen food including local vegetables, household cleaning and first aid materials. The average price spent is 27p. As well as working in the shop, she gives people directions and tells people when the next bus is due. It was proposed in 1950 that there should be a Sub-Post Office in the Rettendon school area, but this was not opened until 1982. The shop is known as 'Oakdene Stores'.
